items.title: Rams' Puka Nacua returns vs. Texans after concussion scare
items.summary: The Los Angeles Rams are facing the Houston Texans in their season opener on Sunday. After a preseason full of Matthew Stafford injury concerns, the quarterback was out there to open the season. Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua has returned to the game after being evaluated for a concussion. “WR Puka Nacua is being evaluated for a concussion and is questionable to return,” the Rams' official account reported.

items.title: Rams TE Colby Parkinson injures shoulder, returns vs. Texans
items.summary: RAMS Rams TE Colby Parkinson injures shoulder, returns vs. Texans Tyler Greenawalt Rams Wire The Los Angeles Rams could be down one of their tight ends in their Week 1 matchup with the Houston Texans . The team announced tight end Colby Parkinson is questionable to return with a shoulder injury. He had one catch for 1 yard in the first half. Parkinson was the primary backup for Tyler Higbee. With him out of the lineup, the Rams could use second-round rookie Terrance Ferguson more in Week 1. Update (5:28 p.m. ET): Parkinson returned to the game in the second quarter. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now.

items.title: Why Rams let Cooper Kupp leave for NFC West rival Seahawks
items.summary: Multiple fanbases will have to adjust their eyes on Sunday when they see Cooper Kupp. The long-time Los Angeles Rams star wide receiver is no longer with the Rams. And even more notable, he's with the NFC West divisional rival Seattle Seahawks . And to make it even more fascinating, the Seahawks open Week 1 on Sunday against the San Francisco 49ers , another NFC West team that has plenty of history against Kupp. It'll be a bit odd for everyone. MORE: Michael Vick, DeSean Jackson make personal college football coaching history Why did the Rams let Cooper Kupp leave for the Seahawks? The Rams spent the early portion of this offseason exploring a trade for Cooper Kupp. No one made a suitable offer.

items.title: Five Lessons the Rams Learned From Eagles Season Opener
items.summary: The Los Angeles Rams got a sneak peek at their week three opponent on Thursday and while the team remains focused only on the opponent at hand, once they turn their attention to the Eagles, here are five lessons they'll take with them into the game. Carter was ejected from the game before the first play from scrimmage of the entire 2025 NFL season because he spat on Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott. While some may argue that Prescott spat at the ground in a gesture towards Carter, the fact is that instead of having the foresight to see the opportunity of taking on a rookie guard in Tyler Booker, giving him a clean repeated shot at Prescott, he let his emotions take control and gave the Cowboys offense a clean pocket virtually all night.

items.title: Rams announce one practice squad elevation for Week 1 vs. Texans
items.summary: The Los Angeles Rams haven't made any changes to their 53-man roster or practice squad since setting them last week, a clear indication that they like they guys they have. Teams are allowed to promote two players from the practice squad each week but the Rams decided to elevate just one.

items.title: NFC West Primer: Are 49ers still a threat?
items.summary: (Photo credit: Matt Kartozian-Imagn Images) The San Francisco 49ers were ravaged by injuries last season and went 6-11 just one year after reaching the Super Bowl. It's not hard to forecast that a healthy Christian McCaffrey is the big ingredient needed for a turnaround. But the 49ers did shake up the roster a bit and that also can reignite the fire of veteran holdovers. There is very little chance of San Francisco winning just 35 percent of its games for consecutive seasons after owning the division for multiple seasons. But it will be tough sledding for Brock Purdy and company as the NFC West is shaping up to be one of the most competitive divisions in the NFL. The Los Angeles Rams and Seattle

items.title: Former Rams wide receiver begs Kansas City Chiefs to sign him
items.summary: The Kansas City Chiefs are 0-1 following a Week 1 loss to the Los Angeles Chargers . Kansas City lost Xavier Worthy early in the first quarter after he collided with Travis Kelce, and their lack of star-power at receiver became painfully evident. Because of this, former Los Angeles Rams wide receiver Allen Robinson took to X to tell the Chiefs to sign him. “No [cap], Chiefs, I'm a free agent, I swear I could help yall,“ Robinson posted. Robinson spent the 2022 season with the Rams, catching 33 passes and three touchdowns before being traded to the Pittsburgh Steelers ahead of the 2023 season. He spent 2024 with the Detroit Lions , appearing in 12 games. Follow The Sporting News on WhatsApp Be
